reviewText: My full review can be found on The Backlog.[www.the-backlog.net]\n\nWithering Kingdom is a wave-based shooter style game in which you need to take down waves of weird looking aliens. This game came out as part of Digital Homicide's May 27th Release 5 games at once" spree
recommended: it's an exact clone of Wyatt Derp (WK is the only one I decided to purchase to try and play). Withering Kingdom features absolutely no main menu screen
hoursPlayed: immediately dumping you into the game with no explanation as to what the controls are. Expect to be clicking your left mouse key a lot to do your shooting and praying that the hits actually hit.\n\nThe game is a mess. The upgrades (from what I could tell) didn't actually seem to do anything. The enemy models glitch out a lot
voteText: and according to another review the alien part of them can even fly off to reveal a cowboy underneath (gee). There is MINOR controller support
helpfulPercent: but by minor I mean you can move and open up the upgrade menu.\n\nAvoid this game. It's a mess
votesTotal: and the hitboxes seem to be all over the place."

reviewText:
This is an uninspired poorly coded, janky, horrifyingly bland asset flip of a game. As shwon in my video, this is one of multiple instances of Digital Homicide's re-skinning video games and re-selling them as new titles. Withering Kingdom and Withering Kingdom 2 are the exact same game with a camera angle change. It is also a reskin of Wyatt Derp and Wyatt Derp 2, along with Krog Wars. The conveyor belt of crap continues as they don't even bother to flip different assets. Why bother when you can simply slap another skin on it and sell it as a new game!

Seriously. Avoid this crap at all costs.

If you are interested in seeing what I'm talking about, see my report here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3h532IZSEQA

reviewText:
Withering Kingdom: Arcane War is a game that I can't recommend because:
- it is boring
- it has issues
- you cannot aim the enemies
- the controls cannot be redefined
- there are no settings
- it is a pointless game
- the only good reason to install this game is for the trading cards

date: comes another piece of garbage.\nMonotonous.  Every level is the same.  What you see in the video on the Store page is all that happens in the entire game.\nLeft

reviewText:
I bought this game for the cards, having no expectations after reading the reviews.
I paid 0,10$ because I got a coupon from a badge, and I must say it's not that bad, especially if you enjoy playing with barbie dolls and toy cars (yeah, I'm saying this game is for kids).
This game is just eye candy. It has tons of issues, but the kids are too stupid to realize what is going on.
My only complaint is that there is no option to disable the sound.
